snippet: A group of students, faculty members and alumni mounted a legal challenge to the decision by Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art to begin charging tuition this fall.
abstract: New York State Supreme Court Judge Nancy M Bannon hears arguments in case brought by group of students, faculty members and alumni who are challenging decision by Cooper Union, one of country's few free colleges, to begin charging tuition.
lead_paragraph: A group of students, faculty members and alumni mounted a legal challenge to the decision by Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art to begin charging tuition this fall.
